snippet: In exchange for a fee, district attorneys’ offices have been allowing debt collectors to use their letterhead when going after people behind on their bills.
abstract: Consumer lawyers have filed lawsuits across the country challenging the increasingly widespread practice of prosecutors' allowing debt-collectors to send letters to delinquent borrowers on the prosecutors' letterheads; prosecutors say that the partnerships allow them to focus on more serious crimes.
lead_paragraph: In exchange for a fee, district attorneys’ offices have been allowing debt collectors to use their letterhead when going after people behind on their bills.

headline.main: In Prosecutors, Debt Collectors Find a Partner
headline.print_headline: In Prosecutors, Debt Collectors Find a Partner
